channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Luxury Brands Have a Strict Hierarchy. Burberry Found Out the Hard Way.
item.description: The British label’s seven-year push to attract wealthier shoppers has failed and left it with a threadbare share price.

item.title: Target beats on earnings and revenue, but gives cautious sales outlook for the year
item.description: The discounter's sales rose as shoppers made more visits to Target's stores and website.

item.title: Schwab Wants to Fix Its Struggling Bank. Investors Are Skeptical.
item.description: Roughly half of the brokerage’s revenue comes from banking.

item.title: Alibaba earnings miss expectations despite cloud acceleration
item.description: Alibaba continues to face headwinds in its core e-commerce business amid rising competition and a cautious Chinese consumer.

item.title: Texas Instruments Tries to Ease Its Capital Pain
item.description: The chip maker says it might moderate capital spending in 2026 amid activist pressure, but new cash flow targets also hinge on revenue pulling out of an extended slump.

item.title: Palo Alto Networks extends recent stock rally on solid earnings. It may be too much, too fast
item.description: The roughly 27% rally since Aug. 5 brings the stock just a few dollars shy of its record-high close of nearly $377 on Feb. 9.

item.title: As Generation X Approaches Retirement, Reality Still Bites
item.description: The ‘forgotten generation,’ born between 1965 and 1980, launched their careers at the start of a massive shift in how Americans work.

item.title: Lowe's cuts full-year outlook as it expects weaker home improvement sales
item.description: Lowe's said customers took on fewer discretionary home projects and unfavorable weather hurt sales of outdoor and seasonal items.

item.title: How to Plan for Retirement if You're Behind on Saving in Middle Age
item.description: Many financial advisers say people in their 40s and 50s still have time to increase their savings rate and develop a road map for their later years.

item.title: Palo Alto Networks finally gets back on track — delivering strong earnings and a promising outlook
item.description: After two rough quarters, Palo Alto reports the type of earnings we expect from one of the best cybersecurity companies in the world
